TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CborWriter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A writer for Concise Binary Object Representation (CBOR) encoded data.

MemberSignature.Value: public CborWriter (System.Formats.Cbor.CborConformanceMode conformanceMode = System.Formats.Cbor.CborConformanceMode.Strict, bool convertIndefiniteLengthEncodings = false, bool allowMultipleRootLevelValues = false);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Formats.Cbor.CborConformanceMode conformanceMode, bool convertIndefiniteLengthEncodings, bool allowMultipleRootLevelValues) cil managed

Public Sub New (Optional conformanceMode As CborConformanceMode = System.Formats.Cbor.CborConformanceMode.Strict, Optional convertIndefiniteLengthEncodings As Boolean = false, Optional allowMultipleRootLevelValues As Boolean = false)
new System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter : System.Formats.Cbor.CborConformanceMode * bool * bool -> System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter

Docs.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the guidance on the conformance checks performed on the encoded data. Defaults to conformance mode.

to enable automatically converting indefinite-length encodings into definite-length equivalents and allow use of indefinite-length write APIs in conformance modes that otherwise do not permit it; otherwise, .
to allow multiple root-level values to be written by the writer; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this writer allows multiple root-level CBOR data items.

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes that have been written to the buffer.

Docs.summary: Gets the conformance mode used by this writer.

Docs.summary: Returns a new array containing the encoded value.

Docs.param: The buffer in which to write.
Docs.summary: Writes the encoded representation of the data to .
Docs.returns: The number of bytes written to .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteCborNegativeIntegerRepresentation(unsigned int64 value) cil managed

Docs.param: An unsigned integer denoting -1 minus the integer.
Docs.summary: Writes the provided value as a CBOR negative integer representation (major type 1).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method supports encoding integers between -18446744073709551616 and -1. Useful for handling values that do not fit in the <xref:System.Int64> type.

Docs.exception:
Writing a new value exceeds the definite length of the parent data item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteStartArray(valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> definiteLength) cil managed
Public Sub WriteStartArray (definiteLength As Nullable(Of Integer))

Docs.param: The length of the definite-length array, or for an indefinite-length array.
Docs.summary: Writes the start of a definite or indefinite-length array (major type 4).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In canonical conformance modes, the writer will reject indefinite-length writes unless the <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.ConvertIndefiniteLengthEncodings> flag is enabled.

Docs.exception: The parameter cannot be negative.

Writing a new value exceeds the definite length of the parent data item.
-or-
The major type of the encoded value is not permitted in the parent data item.
-or-
The written data is not accepted under the current conformance mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteStartIndefiniteLengthByteString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes the start of an indefinite-length byte string (major type 2).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Pushes a context where definite-length chunks of the same major type can be written. In canonical conformance modes, the writer will reject indefinite-length writes unless the <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.ConvertIndefiniteLengthEncodings> flag is enabled.

Docs.exception:
Writing a new value exceeds the definite length of the parent data item.
-or-
The major type of the encoded value is not permitted in the parent data item.
-or-
The written data is not accepted under the current conformance mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteStartIndefiniteLengthTextString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes the start of an indefinite-length UTF-8 string (major type 3).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Pushes a context where definite-length chunks of the same major type can be written. In canonical conformance modes, the writer will reject indefinite-length writes unless the <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.ConvertIndefiniteLengthEncodings> flag is enabled.

Docs.exception:
Writing a new value exceeds the definite length of the parent data item.
-or-
The major type of the encoded value is not permitted in the parent data item.
-or-
The written data is not accepted under the current conformance mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteStartMap(valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> definiteLength) cil managed
Public Sub WriteStartMap (definiteLength As Nullable(Of Integer))

Docs.param: The length of the definite-length map, or for an indefinite-length map.
Docs.summary: Writes the start of a definite or indefinite-length map (major type 5).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In canonical conformance modes, the writer will reject indefinite-length writes unless the <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.ConvertIndefiniteLengthEncodings> flag is enabled.
Map contents are written as if arrays twice the length of the map's declared size. For instance, a map of size `1` containing a key of type int with a value of type string must be written by successive calls to <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.WriteInt32(System.Int32)> and <xref:System.Formats.Cbor.CborWriter.WriteTextString(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})>. It is up to the caller to keep track of whether the next call is a key or a value.
Fundamentally, this is a technical restriction stemming from the fact that CBOR allows keys of any type, for instance a map can contain keys that are maps themselves.

Docs.exception: The parameter cannot be negative.

Writing a new value exceeds the definite length of the parent data item.
-or-
The major type of the encoded value is not permitted in the parent data item.
-or-
The written data is not accepted under the current conformance mode.
